author: gstein
msg: Add functionality to the mailer to enable remapping values. This provides
a simple mechanism for constructing values where there is no direct
translation between the inputs and the desired outputs. This feature is
particularly useful for constructing from/to mailing addresses.
* hooks/mailer/mailer.py:
(Config._predefined): add the new [maps] section
(Config.__init__): just store section names into the _groups instance
data. having the subsection in there would have made it hard for
the new _prep_maps() method to remove groups from the list. call
_prep_maps() at the right point.
(Config.get): add in the value remapping code. we simply use remapping
functions store in the self.maps subsection object.
(Config._prep_maps): new method to rewrite the self.maps string values
into callables for .get() to perform the value remapping.
(Config._prep_groups): the _groups variable no longer has the subsection
object in it, so look it up.
(Config.UnknownMappingSection, Config.UnknownMappingSpec): new errors
* hooks/mailer/mailer.conf.example:
- add documentation about the builtin author variable
- add the [maps] section and a bunch of docco for it
